729446f-b.title: Richmond: Richmond Terrace - St. Peter's Place
729446f-b.text:
Richmond Terrace, south side, between St. Peters Place and Nicholas Street, showing St. Peters Roman Catholic School. The 2-1/2-story frame house,on the left, is the Staten
Island Women's Club. The view is eastward.
May 2, 1928
P. L. Sperr
(2)
A closer view of the Staten Island Women's Club, and
St. Peters School. The view is westward.
May 2, 1928
P. L. Sperr
729446f-b.folder: Richmond Terrace & St. Peter's Place, Staten Island, NY

729447f-a.title: Richmond: Richmond Terrace - St. Peter's Place
729447f-a.text:
Richmond Terrace, at the S.E. corner of St. Peters Place, showing an old mansion in the Corinthian order of classical Greek architecture.It belonged to Mrs. Feiller in 1874; to Mrs. L. Neilson in 1898, and to Chas. Rosenberg in 1907. In the backgrOund appears St. Peters Roman Catholic Church.
May 2, 1928
P. L. Sperr
